data.name: Make a break
data.description:
# Task

You are working on a assembly line with very strict rules. Breaks are only allowed if you have nothing to do for a given time (idle timeout). Every break increases this time.

Implement a function `startWorking` with two arguments. The first argument is the `doBreak` function, which is called whenever you want to do a break. The second argument is the idle timeout before you are allowed to call `doBreak`.  
Return a new function which is called everytime you have to work. If this function is not called during the idle timeout, call another function `doBreak`.  
Every break increases the idle timeout for your next break by 100 miliseconds.  
Your break is over when the next work is requested.  
You always end with a break.  
It's not allowed to do a break before the returned function is called.

## Example

```
Initial idle timeout: 100ms

First call at 0ms
Second call at 80ms
First break at 180ms; Timeout changed to 200ms
Third call at 200ms
Fourth call at 350ms
Second break at 550ms; Timeout changed to 300ms
Fifth call at 600ms
Third break at 900ms
```

## Tests

Running tests require 6-10 seconds to complete, depending on the timeouts of the random tests.

## Resources

- https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/WindowOrWorkerGlobalScope/setTimeout
- https://redd.one/blog/debounce-vs-throttle
